title: Journalists flag Samoa’s draft media protocol
content: “It seems that the government is shutting down all avenues to remain transparent. Why does a government do that when there is nothing to hide?”

title: Sixteen days of activism amid the rise of digital harm across Africa
content: Across Africa, Reporters Without Borders has documented sustained online harassment and surveillance targeting women journalists in West Africa, noting that digital abuse has become an emerging barrier to press freedom.
creator: Cecilia Maundu

title: Hong Kong media tycoon Jimmy Lai found guilty under national security law
content: Lai was found guilty of conspiring to collude with foreign forces and sedition. The maximum penalty is life imprisonment and the court will determine the final sentence early next year.
creator: Hong Kong Free Press

title: Australia's under 16 social media ban under microscope at home and abroad
content: "The social media feeds that once connected us are now driving us apart. Social media algorithms are flooding young men’s feeds with radical misogynistic content, inciting real-world harm.'
creator: Kevin Rennie

title: A Filipino journalist pushes back against red-tagging and disinformation by taking on Meta
content: In 2023, journalist Cong Corrales filed a landmark case against Meta to obtain the identities behind the accounts that had led a vicious smear operation against him.
creator: Mong Palatino

title: Why cybersafety matters in the African Union–European Union partnership
content: Research shows that women are less likely to access the Internet than men and face higher exposure to harassment once they are online. These conditions limit participation and restrict leadership.
creator: Cecilia Maundu

title: Similar type of bot attacks target Instagram profiles of Serbian student movement and Macedonian independent media outlet
